Brigitte Bardot, global film icon and champion of animal rights, has died
subhead: The actress who triggered a revolution with her performance in 'And God Created Woman' passed away on December 28 at the age of 91. She appeared in 56 films before ending her career in 1973 and devoting her life to animal rights.

After five years of civil war, Myanmar junta stages an election
subhead: The ruling junta touted the vote – which has been criticized by Western diplomats and the UN rights chief – as a return to democracy. Former civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi remains in jail.

title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky travels to Florida to secure Trump's support
subhead: Four days after unveiling a 'draft agreement' to end the war, the Ukrainian president is due to meet his US counterpart in Florida on Sunday to address outstanding issues and show that Moscow – not Kyiv – remains the obstacle to peace.

title: US and Nigeria offer diverging accounts of strikes on militants
subhead: Washington and Abuja agree that the Christmas-timed operation targeted Islamic State-linked militants, but they give conflicting accounts of which groups were struck and how the attacks were carried out.

title: Trump, the Apocalypse and King David: A theological reading of the US president
subhead: Since his first term, the American president has frequently made apocalyptic and messianic references. Some supporters compare him to biblical figures such as King David, appealing particularly to evangelical Christians, who make up about one-fifth of Americans.

subhead: Even though the photo galleries of their 'parents' are typically replete with dog photos, a new generation of professional photographers is nonetheless making a living out of artfully crafted canine portraits.

title: Semiconductors: Nvidia at the heart of the new Pacific battle
subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (1/5):  Whether it's AI, electronics or defense, the 'silicon economy' drives the entire industrial and service sectors. It is at the heart of a fierce battle between global powers, with China seeking to free itself from dependence on US technologies.

title: Six thousand new perfumes in 2025: Why manufacturers are flooding the market
subhead: The perfume sector is experiencing a global consumption revolution: Young people are collecting bottles, and Chinese consumers are buying more and more. With L'Oréal leading the way, perfume has become the main sector driving the cosmetics industry.
